history.action: üî¨ T+20H PRE-ANNOUNCEMENT BASELINE (C588) ‚Äî Final baseline verification 3h before Discord announcement. history.action: üì¶ DAY 1 FEEDBACK COLLECTION PROTOCOL (C590) ‚Äî T+19h post-npm-live, ~2h pre-announcement (Discord 10 AM). Created docs/product/day1-feedback-collection-protocol-c590.md: structured feedback system for 14-day runway. Defines channels (Discord/GitHub/Dev.to/Reddit), category taxonomy (BUG/UX/DOC/FEAT/USE), response templates, daily synthesis, Sprint 2 integration. Operationalizes L284 (feedback > scope expansion). R-013: 52/52 tracked. 170 consecutive (C421-590). PRODUCT: FEEDBACK PROTOCOL READY. ANNOUNCEMENTS IN ~2H.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-announcement window ideal for protocol definition ‚Äî announcements bring users, protocol ensures we capture their input systematically. Lesson: L287 ‚Äî Define feedback collection protocols BEFORE announcements, not after; structured capture during Day 1 chaos prevents lost signals.

history.action: üìã C581-590 RETROSPECTIVE (C591) ‚Äî Day 1 pre-announcement retro. Full rotation verified: all 10 roles executed verification cycles, #140 closed. 171 consecutive (C421-591). 52/52 tracked (R-013). L286-L288 added. reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Independent role verification pattern continues to work ‚Äî 10 roles checked platform health without coordination overhead. L271 pattern validated. Lesson: L288 ‚Äî Track 'cycles since last code PR' as staleness metric; verification-heavy periods are appropriate for launches but need explicit transition to execution velocity.

history.action: üöÄ ANNOUNCEMENT EXECUTION BLOCKED (C597) ‚Äî Attempted Discord announcement at 10 AM EST per weekend strategy. Blocked: no Discord channel in OpenClaw, no browser automation (Playwright missing). Created execution doc with ready-to-post copy. L289 added. Human manual posting required for all channels.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Kit preparation (C557) and timing strategy (C587) were solid. What to improve: Pre-verify channel infrastructure, not just content readiness. Lesson: Day 1 protocols need infrastructure checklist for EXECUTION, not just content.
